Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Marketplace Analyst, Ride-hailing
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Analyst to join our Marketplace Rides team to help us improve and scale our pricing and matching algorithms that make millions of rides happen every day across 50+ countries!




About Us

With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.




We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or disability.




Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!




About The Role

As a catalyst for discovery, you will boost current mechanics and contribute to new features in our pricing and matching domains. You will have an opportunity to apply your expertise in experimentation, causal inference and microeconomics to optimally match demand and supply.




In this role, you will develop and scale systems to improve the entire marketplace experience. These are truly unique problems to crack. Sounds interesting? Join us as a Senior Product Analyst and take a seat in our journey to revolutionise ride-hailing!




Your daily adventures will include:

Discovering new opportunities by conducting exploratory research and deep-diving into what drives our marketplace
Analysing feature performance, identifying points of improvement and designing new solutions based on your analysis
Owning and enforcing A/B testing best practices end-to-end, in other words validating features, designing & analysing experiments and making sure we take action
Designing relevant and actionable metrics to make better and faster decisions
Contributing to the conceptualisation and development of analytical solutions such as marketplace simulations or self-service data products
Closely collaborating with Product Managers, Engineers and Data Scientists to build, prioritise and execute our roadmap




About you:

You hold a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Economics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Management or similar studies
You have 3+ years of experience working in Product Analytics and/or Data Science
You rank your SQL skills as “outstanding” & Python/R skills as “profound” and you have experience with some BI tools and data visualisation
You are fluent in English and your verbal and written communication is outstanding
You have a solid understanding of end-to-end A/B testing; experience with advanced experimentation such as switchback tests or other causal inference methods is an advantage
You are confident in applying basic notions of microeconomics in practice and have a basic understanding of supervised machine-learning models




Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!




Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.

Title: BESS Data Analyst (m/w/d) for Equipment Health Monitoring
Description:
Job Description

At RollsRoyce Powersystems we develop and build Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). Additionally, we offer Long-Term Service Agreements (LTSA). In order to ensure the highest availability possible, we analyze operational data and predict on future scenarios. For this work we need a Data Analyst to develop and improve our Dashboards for our Equipment Health Monitoring (EHM). Therefore, this role is part of our Service Team for BESS.

Tasks – What To Expect From Us


Support our Equipment Health Monitoring Team to create Dashboards for different type of users on our Cloud platform.
Analyzing in-field battery energy storage systems.
Calculating and comparing health and performance KPIs between in-field systems.
In case of on-site problems, perform data analysis and troubleshoot the problems in collaboration with the service team and with engineers.
Create detailed reports describing the issues, root causes, and suggested remedies.
Cooperate with our suppliers and their technical teams.


Qualifications – Who We Are Looking For


Background in electrical engineering and system control and automation.
Very good knowledge of battery energy storage systems and new technologies such as microgrids.
Ideally, previous experience in the battery energy storage system industry.
Very good knowledge of data analysis tools (mainly python) and their different libraries. (Pandas, NumPy, Seaborn and visualization libraries such as Matplotlib, Plotly). Experience in Apache PySpark is a plus.
Proficiency in English and German both written and spoken.
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset.


Why Rolls-Royce Power Systems – What You Will Get


Company-owned health insurance BKK MTU for our employees and their family members
Comprehensive corporate health management including a company fitness program (EGYM Wellpass)
Attractive company pension scheme – Save for your retirement with us!
Disability insurance – Protection for all cases!
Mobility support in everyday life – JobTicket and JobRad
Corporate benefits program – Great employee discounts on numerous strong brands


We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential. You can learn more about our global Inclusion strategy here.

Your contact person

Ana Maria De Los Rios

careers@ps.rolls-royce.com

Note: Please apply exclusively online through our career portal. Applications through other channels (especially via email) cannot be considered.

Type of Contract

Permanent

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.
Show more
HTML:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Analyst to join our Marketplace Rides team to help us improve and scale our pricing and matching algorithms that make millions of rides happen every day across 50+ countries!

About Us

With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.

We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or disability.

Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!

About The Role

As a catalyst for discovery, you will boost current mechanics and contribute to new features in our pricing and matching domains. You will have an opportunity to apply your expertise in experimentation, causal inference and microeconomics to optimally match demand and supply.

In this role, you will develop and scale systems to improve the entire marketplace experience. These are truly unique problems to crack. Sounds interesting? Join us as a Senior Product Analyst and take a seat in our journey to revolutionise ride-hailing!

Your daily adventures will include:

  • Discovering new opportunities by conducting exploratory research and deep-diving into what drives our marketplace
  • Analysing feature performance, identifying points of improvement and designing new solutions based on your analysis
  • Owning and enforcing A/B testing best practices end-to-end, in other words validating features, designing & analysing experiments and making sure we take action
  • Designing relevant and actionable metrics to make better and faster decisions
  • Contributing to the conceptualisation and development of analytical solutions such as marketplace simulations or self-service data products
  • Closely collaborating with Product Managers, Engineers and Data Scientists to build, prioritise and execute our roadmap


About you:

  • You hold a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Economics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Management or similar studies
  • You have 3+ years of experience working in Product Analytics and/or Data Science
  • You rank your SQL skills as “outstanding” & Python/R skills as “profound” and you have experience with some BI tools and data visualisation
  • You are fluent in English and your verbal and written communication is outstanding
  • You have a solid understanding of end-to-end A/B testing; experience with advanced experimentation such as switchback tests or other causal inference methods is an advantage
  • You are confident in applying basic notions of microeconomics in practice and have a basic understanding of supervised machine-learning models


Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:

  • Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
  • Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50 countries.
  • Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
  • Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
  • Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
  • Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
  • Some perks may differ depending on your location.

Title: Praktikant:in Data Analyst (gn)
Company: Intermate – Full Service Social Media Agency
Description:
Jobbeschreibung
ÜBER UNS


Wir brechen seit 2015 das Influencer- und Social Media Marketing auf, wie kaum eine andere Agentur. Dabei etablieren wir uns gerade als eine der größten Social Powerhouses im DACH Raum. Wir sind mittlerweile über 210 Social 1st Mitarbeiter:innen, haben 2 Inhouse Studios, eine eigene Produktionsfirma, eine eigene Social Technologie und eigene Mediakanäle mit über 1 Mio. Follower:innen. Mit Standorten in Berlin, Hamburg und Köln arbeiten wir in der Kreation, im Projektmanagement, in der Beratung, im Social Media und im Performance Marketing sowie in der (Post-)Production.


WAS DU MACHST:



Unterstützung bei der Analyse und Auswertung von Influencer Marketing Kennzahlen: Du hilfst bei der Erfassung und grundlegenden Analyse von Social Media Daten.


Gemeinsam mit dem Team erstellst du einfache Auswertungen und hilfst dabei, die Ergebnisse anschaulich für Projektmanager:innen und Kund:innen aufzubereiten.


Mitwirken an Datenanalysen zur Bewertung von Influencer Marketing Kampagnen für einen unserer größten Beauty-Kunden: Du unterstützt das Team bei der Vorbereitung von Datenanalysen, die Einblicke in die Performance unserer Kampagnen und der Wettbewerber geben.


Dabei lernst du verschiedene Tools und Methoden kennen, um die wichtigsten Kennzahlen zur Performance zu ermitteln.


Identifizierung von Verbesserungspotenzialen: Du beobachtest die Ergebnisse von Kampagnen und hilfst dem Team, Verbesserungspotenziale zu identifizieren. Gemeinsam entwickelt ihr einfache Ansätze zur Optimierung und setzt erste Lösungsideen um.


Erstellen von Datenvisualisierungen und Präsentationen: Du unterstützt bei der Erstellung von Präsentationen und Berichten, die zentrale Analyseergebnisse anschaulich visualisieren. Dabei lernst du die Grundlagen des „Data Storytelling“, um verschiedene Zielgruppen mit Dateninhalten zu erreichen und zu informieren.



Stellenanforderungen


WAS DU BRAUCHST:





Du studierst aktuell Mathematik, Wirtschaft, Informatik, Statistik oder einen ähnlichen Studiengang und interessierst dich für Zahlen und Daten


Du suchst aktuell einen Praktikumsplatz für mindestens 6 Monate


Du glänzt mit ersten Kenntnissen in Datenanalysen und bist echter Excel-Profi oder hast schon erste Erfahrungen mit Statistikprogrammen (wie z.B. R, SPSS, Stata, SAS) gesammelt


Auch Google Sheets kannst du problemlos bedienen


Du verfügst über starke analytische Fähigkeiten und kannst auch große Mengen an Informationen organisieren und analysieren.


Du fällst durch deine hohe Motivation und Lernbereitschaft auf, kannst dich und deine Aufgaben sehr gut selbst strukturieren und verfügst über exzellente Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.


Du hast sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.



WAS WIR DIR BIETEN:


💫 Unsere Benefits – made for Mates.


Be the vibe.


Be the change.
Be a mate.
Wir glauben: Wenn du wachsen willst, brauchst du Raum. Energie. Und Menschen, die dich unterstützen. Unsere Benefits schaffen genau das.





🧭 Flexibel bleiben – so wie du’s brauchst: Arbeit soll zu deinem Leben passen, nicht umgekehrt. Mit unserem hybriden Modell entscheidest du, wo du am besten performst – im Office oder remote.


🎉 Momente, die zählen – Zeit, die dir gehört



27 Urlaubstage + dein Geburtstagsfrei, weil du es wert bist.


24.12. & 31.12. gibt’s geschenkt – für die besonderen Zeiten mit den Menschen, die dir wichtig sind.

We care. You celebrate.






💪 Balance halten – Körper, Geist & Energie



Nilo.health Mitgliedschaft, wenn du mentale Power brauchst.

Denn: Mates kümmern sich – auch um sich selbst






🤝 Team Spirit – gemeinsam geht mehr: Regelmäßige Teamevents, inspirierende Offsites, ein Miteinander, das man spürt. Denn: Be a mate – ist mehr als nur ein Satz.


💻 Arbeitsumfeld mit Vibe



Hochwertige Ausstattung, stylische Büros in Berlin, Hamburg und Köln


Snacks, Drinks & monatliche Team-Lunches – weil gute Gespräche oft in der Küche beginnen.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Revenue Intelligence)
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

Identify and escalate negative and positive trends in main customer and category KPIs to boost the company’s growth and profitability.

Responsibilities


Conduct in-depth economic analyses on current trading performance, market research, demand forecasting, pricing strategies, and competitor analysis.
Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.



Job Requirements


Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
Proficiency in SQL.
Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Fluent English.



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program – providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work



Join us today and let’s create a success story together!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description:
What To Expect
Tesla is accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. We continuously develop revolutionary strategies and products within shortest time, and successfully launch them on a large scale. This is only possible through extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency.

Gigafactory Berlin forms the perfect basis for rolling out Tesla's incredible success story in Europe. The most important pillar for this is our employees. Their passion, motivation and engagement ensure that we consistently achieve our goals. We are looking for you to continue and expand this success story together. 

The Role

Come join a team of experts building the systems that improve and perfect quality at Tesla.

We are looking for a motivated data scientist / data engineer that is capable of designing and developing value-add data-driven applications. You will be designing and building highly-scalable and performant applications that will deliver functionality to our engineers to enable them to deliver the best quality.

What You'll Do


Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed. Conduct analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations
Work with stakeholders to take a vague problem statement, refine the scope of the analysis, and use the results to drive informed decisions
Identifying opportunities, designing solutions and providing software tools that increase manufacturing quality
Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale
Operate and support your production applications



What You'll Bring


High proficiency in Python, SQL
Strong foundation in statistics and machine learning
Experience building machine learning models that provided company value
Background in writing software in a professional environment, writing clean and tested code
Worked with DevOps and CICD (Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins,…)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Clearly documenting your work is key
Smart but humble, with a bias for action



Nice to have

Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science/ Engineering or equivalent.
Fullstack knowledge
Familiarity with tools such as Airflow, Elastic Search
Basic sysadmin capabilities
Practical knowledge of Hadoop, Spark and with streaming and stream processing frameworks such kafka, mqtt, faust, spark streaming etc.



What we offer

You will be working in our state-of-the-art Gigafactory where you’ll solve the world's most interesting problems with the best and brightest people who share a passion to change the world. Tesla’s compensation package includes competitive salary and Tesla shares or bonuses. Typical benefits that are offered are a pension program, 30 vacation days, employee insurances, free EV charging stations and public commuting support.

, Tesla

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - 6 Month FTC




Chapter 2 provides technologists to our customers to accelerate innovation and drive their business forward. Specializing in staff augmentation, we embed top-tier technology talent with companies seeking agility, expertise, and seamless integration into existing teams.




We are building a Product Analytics team for one of Europe's largest e-commerce companies and hiring multiple analysts on a full-time, Fixed-Term Contract (FTC) basis.




Data is crucial to developing their products and championing customer experiences. The team will evaluate digital experiences and deliver impactful insights to enhance their personalization, recommendations, browsing, and search experiences.




You'll collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, applied scientists, and business leaders, leading data exploration, A/B testing, and hypothesis analysis to deeply understand their customers and products. You’ll also track and report key performance indicators (KPIs).




The Role:




Define analytical strategies, align stakeholders, and independently deliver impactful insights.
Deeply analyze user behaviors to drive product growth and improvements.
Influence product decisions through robust, data-backed recommendations.
Define and monitor essential product KPIs.
Design, analyze, and interpret A/B tests and quasi-experiments.
Act as a stakeholder liaison to align and communicate effectively around data insights.




About You:




Experience in analytics roles (Digital Analytics, Product Analytics, Business Intelligence), preferably in e-commerce.
Strong understanding of e-commerce KPIs and SQL (including nested/repeated data).
Proficiency in advanced analytics tools, preferably Python, and familiarity with statistical modeling.
Expert knowledge of A/B testing methodologies.
Experience analyzing user behavior data (e.g., Google Analytics).
Strong communication skills, capable of clearly presenting insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Chapter 2




At Chapter 2, we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming workplace where everyone belongs. Regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, or neurodiversity, we celebrate the unique perspectives that make us stronger. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and will accommodate any recruitment or interview adjustments needed to create a smooth and comfortable experience. Your individuality matters, and we believe that diverse philosophies, cultures, and experiences drive innovation and success.

Show more

Title: Staff Product Analyst [Data Alliance] (m/f/d)
Description:
The role

As a Staff Product Analyst you are an all-rounder who thrives equally working on technical topics as well as value-delivery through insights, presentation and data visualisation. Indeed, your extensive experience and knowledge across technical and business related topics enables you to go “end to end” with a high level of quality and scalability as well as driving best practices within the Product Analytics community. Not limited to one squad or domain, your impact is across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying common needs and pain points across the teams and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practice across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access, and wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


#data

HTML:
The role

As a Staff Product Analyst you are an all-rounder who thrives equally working on technical topics as well as value-delivery through insights, presentation and data visualisation. Indeed, your extensive experience and knowledge across technical and business related topics enables you to go “end to end” with a high level of quality and scalability as well as driving best practices within the Product Analytics community. Not limited to one squad or domain, your impact is across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying common needs and pain points across the teams and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practice across our teams.

What You’ll Do

  • Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
  • Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
  • Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
  • Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
  • Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
  • Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
  • Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams

What You'll Bring

  • Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
  • Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
  • Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
  • Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
  • Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
  • Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
  • A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
  • You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.

  • Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
  • Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
  • Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
  • Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
  • Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access, and wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

#data

JR102946

Title: Werkstudent:in Power BI (m/w/d)
Description:
WILLKOMMEN BEI UNS

Kompetente und engagierte Kolleg:innen sind entscheidend für unseren Erfolg bei BASF. Mit Knowhow und Leidenschaft vereinen wir in unserer Service Einheit "People" alle Personal- und Kommunikationsthemen, die sich auf die zwischenmenschliche Interaktion ausrichten. Unser Portfolio im HR-Bereich deckt von A wie Arbeitgebermarke bis Z wie Zeitwirtschaft alles ab, während die Kommunikation weltweit das postive Image der BASF gegenüber internen und externen Anspruchsgruppen prägt.

WAS DICH ERWARTET

Ab sofort bieten wir Dir die Möglichkeit, unsere HR-Einheit als Werkstudent:in zu verstärken. Hilf uns, Prozesse durch neue Technologien und Arbeitsmethoden zu optimieren!

Die Stelle ist bis zum 31.12.2025 befristet mit Möglichkeit zur Vertragsverlängerung.


Du erstellst, pflegst und weiterentwickelst Reports und Dashboards mit Power BI für verschiedene Aspekte unseres HR-Geschäfts.
Du arbeitest eng mit den Fachabteilungen zusammen, um deren Anforderungen und Fragen zu verstehen und zu beantworten.
Du integrierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, bereitest diese auf und analysierst sie, um neue Erkenntnisse zu generieren und Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten.
Du suchst proaktiv nach Digitalisierungsmöglichkeiten, initiierst diese und prüfst Digitalisierungsprojekte auf die technische Umsetzbarkeit.
In unserer HR-Einheit agierst Du als Ansprechpartner:in für die technische Implementierung von Optimierungen und wirkst bei aktuellen Projekten der Einheit mit.


WAS DU MITBRINGST


laufendes Studium der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Kommunikation, (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung und erste Erfahrung im IT-Bereich
erste Kenntnisse in SAP R3 sowie analytisches Denkvermögen und hohe Zahlenaffinität
gute bis sehr gute Erfahrung mit MS-Office, insbesondere MS Power BI
Technikaffinität und Spaß an Digitalisierungsthemen
fließende Deutsch- und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse


WAS WIR BIETEN


Dein Stundenlohn liegt bei 14,57 Euro bei einer individuell vereinbarten Wochenarbeitszeit von 20 Stunden
Dir steht immer ein fester Ansprechpartner zur Seite und Du arbeitest in einer angenehmen Arbeitsatmosphäre mit einem modernen Team
Mobiles Arbeiten, damit Du deinen Arbeitsalltag und Dein Privatleben flexibler gestalten und besser vereinen kannst
Modernes nachhaltiges Bürogebäude in Berlin-Prenzlauer Berg mit flexiblen Arbeitsmöglichkeiten, Dachterrasse und Cafeteria für ein innovatives und teamfokussiertes Zusammenarbeiten
Vorsorge- und Fitnessangebote, um Deine Gesundheit zu fördern und einen Ausgleich zur Arbeit zu bieten


SO ERREICHST DU UNS


Annika Emmerich (Talent Acquisition), annika.emmerich@basf.com, beantwortet gerne Deine Fragen für diese Position
Unser Recruiting-Team erreichst Du auch hier
Erste Informationen zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess findest Du hier


ÜBER UNS

Die BASF Services Europe GmbH bündelt als internationaler Service HUB eine Vielzahl von Leistungen für die BASF-Gruppe in ganz Europa. Im Herzen Berlins vereinen wir dafür Know-How in den Bereichen Finance, HR, Supply Chain, Procurement, Product Safety und IT. Digital und kundenzentriert gestalten wir Services mit Zukunft. Erfahre mehr über uns unter: basf.com/servicehub-berlin

Vielfalt ist unsere größte Stärke!

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsformel und gestalten Sie mit uns die Zukunft – in einem globalen Team, das Inklusion und Chancengleichheit unabhängig von Geschlecht, Alter, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Behinderung oder Weltanschauung lebt.

Title: Team Lead Data Science (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled Team Leader to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages cutting-edge technology to gather and analyze data, optimizing our platforms and processes.

AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

Job Description


Collaborate closely with your team and key stakeholders to convert business requirements into Machine Learning solutions
Foster a culture that values data-driven decision-making within the organization and aid in the enhancement of our data platform
Offer ML and engineering expertise and ensure your team builds, deploys and maintains high standards models
Drive innovation and creativity within your team, encouraging them to explore new data science techniques and approaches
Empower your team by supporting members to grow and take ownership of data science projects
Continually assess and improve the team's performance, setting clear expectations and providing constructive feedback


Qualifications


Deep knowledge in statistical and quantitative analysis, coupled with practical expertise in SQL and Python, honed over several years. Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a significant advantage
Proven leadership skills, with a track record of delivering end-to-end Machine Learning products in collaborative environments
Excellent communication skills: you can effectively interact with stakeholders to understand their requirements, as well as communicate complex technical concepts to your data science colleagues
Machine Learning: hands-on experience with a wide array of machine learning methods, along with the ability to discern the most suitable technique for various problems
Strong motivational and managerial skills to guide, support, and inspire your team to reach their objectives


Additional Information


30 days of vacation per year.
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development.
Freedom to choose the operating system you prefer working with.
Exciting team events like Hackathons, foster collaboration and innovation.
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars.


Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst




Get The Future You Want!

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.




Your Role

Monitored and tracked changes to the data dictionary in alignment with ongoing migration and evolving user stories.
Produced detailed configuration-type requirements to support effective UAT testing phases.
Conducted in-depth data item analysis to derive processing rules and ensure accuracy.
Developed relevant use cases to support data processing scenarios during UAT.
Analyzed implications of available data configuration options to guide informed decision-making.
Created data flow models to visualize and validate end-to-end data movement across systems.
Ensured data flow diagrams accurately captured system interactions and dependencies.
Reviewed and validated the configuration of preventative controls implemented in the system.
Assessed control effectiveness in reducing risk and ensuring compliance post-configuration.
Collaborated with stakeholders to refine requirements based on test outcomes and control reviews.




Your Profile

Tracked data dictionary changes in sync with migration and evolving user stories, ensuring consistency.
Produced configuration requirements for UAT, including data item analysis, rule creation, and supporting use cases.
Modeled data flows to validate system interactions and identify dependencies across platforms.
Reviewed and assessed preventative control configurations to ensure risk mitigation and compliance.
Engaged stakeholders to refine and finalize requirements based on UAT results and control effectiveness.




About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.




Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

Title: Analyst, Insights & Analysis
Description:
Job Description

At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we turn dreams into stardom and audiences into fans. We are guided by three core values that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:


Curiosity: We do our best work when we’re immersing ourselves in culture and breaking through barriers. Curiosity is the driving force behind creativity and ingenuity. It fuels innovation, and innovation is the key to our future.
Collaboration: Making music and bringing it to the world is all about the power of originality amplified by teamwork. A great idea, like a great song, travels globally. We ignite passions and build connections across our diverse community of artists, songwriters, partners, and fans.
Commitment: We pursue excellence for our team and our talent. Everything in music starts with a leap into the unknown, and we’re committed to keeping the faith, acting with integrity, and delivering on our promises.


WMG is home to a wide range of artists, musicians, and songwriters that fuel our success. That is why we are committed to creating a work environment that actively values, appreciates, and respects everyone. We encourage applications from people with a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences.

Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.

Job Title: Analyst, Insights & Analysis - Global Marketing

A Little Bit About Our Team

Global Marketing is responsible for developing the careers of artists signed to Warner Music Group outside of their home markets. As addition to supporting your colleagues on the Global Marketing team, you will work with analysts in each market to help deliver an artist's vision and opportunity to the rest of the world.

Your Role

You will ensure that there is a single source of truth for analysis and insights within the global marketing division. You will provide the backbone of data knowledge and insight to guide team direction.

Reporting

Here you’ll get to:


Build and maintain regular reporting / insights documents (Priority Track / Artist Identifier, GPS Tracking, Global Marketing KPIs, success probability scores, etc) for both Global Marketing (GM) team and C-level execs.
Develop and collaborate with internal data teams to build Extract, Transform & Load (ETL) processes for report automation.
Work with Regional / Genre leads and finance team to establish targeting for all Global Priority System (GPS) projects.


Strategy


Use audience reporting to deliver data-driven strategic recommendations for artist growth.
Develop a framework to understand and track performance and influence of key genres and regions.
Assess various data related tools and data sources to determine a product fit for the GM team.


Project Management


Ensure integration of marketing analytics and social analytics within WMG global systems and databases.
Project manage successful delivery of various data-related projects pertinent to Global Marketing in collaboration with relevant internal teams including Business Data Operations, Global Technology and Research & Analysis.
Incorporate analysis, insights & best-practices from within and outside of the business to improve on processes, workflows, reporting & strategy.


About You


Advanced Google Sheets (Excel) capabilities
Experience with Tableau or similar visualization tools
2+ years of experience writing SQL for big datasets
A results-oriented mindset with strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate clearly and effectively (orally and in writing)
Ability to manage time in order to collaborate with colleagues around the world, as well as turnaround quick demands for upper management
Comfort and strength in distilling and presenting complex information to technically diverse audiences
Strong organizational skills with ability to prioritize while work on multiple projects


We’d Love It If You Also Had


Familiarity with Python or R
Experience working in a global or regional role
Experience working in marketing, social and/or digital roles


About Us

As the home to 10K Projects, Asylum, Atlantic Music Group, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalog of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Warner Music Group is also home to ADA, which supports the independent community, as well as artist services division WMX. In addition, WMG counts film and television storytelling powerhouse Warner Music Entertainment among its many brands.

Together, we are Warner Music Group: Independent Minds. Major Sound.

Love this job and want to apply?

Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.

Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.

Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.

WMG is committed to inclusion and diversity in all aspects of our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and will evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, religion or belief, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key purpose of role is to support relevant activity through accurate creation, development and maintenance of all data. Title: JUNIOR INSIGHT ANALYST
Description:
Job Description

JUNIOR INSIGHT ANALYST

London/Hybrid - Customer Success Team

About This Job

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ’s success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you’ll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they’re probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our people.

Our clients come to us with challenges and questions ranging from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ’s Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world’s best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

Our staff are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights, deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients helping them grow their business.  

The successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients’ teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients’ needs and then create and present solutions that help achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

If telling stories through data excites you but you’re uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

Responsibilities


Have a strong working knowledge of the client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals (e.g., participating in business cycles such as brand planning & range reviews etc.)
Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and delete in red Discover
Responsible for identifying sales opportunities through day-to-day engagements with our clients, handing over opportunities to Account Development to pursue


Qualifications

This role would suit you if you are either a newly qualified graduate or have around 2 years work experience, and can demonstrate the following

Essential:


Confident numerically demonstrated by your scientific or other numerate degree or equivalent
Ability to analyse data confidently
Problem solving and solutions orientated
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Engaging presenter and story teller
Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint


Preferred:


Experience of working in an analytical environment
An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
Understanding of UK retail landscape
UK Driving licence


What We Can Offer

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world’s populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry’s top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what’s possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:


Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
Career & Learning development
Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
Becoming an expert in categories that shape UK retail
Joining a market leader where you’ll gain a broad perspective – a market overview of different categories and products. A truly global and diverse organisation with global opportunities.
Access to first-class analytical tools which is a great way to gain understanding of CPG market in general
Great deal of autonomy in performing your role
Exposure to major players on the market such as: P&G, Coca-Cola, Unilever, Nestle


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
At Danone, you’re not just early talent; you’re just in time to take ownership of your career and be empowered to make a difference.




Our Sustainability team is bringing our business purpose to life through our Danone Impact Journey. Across the two-year programme, you’ll gain a breadth of exposure across several projects all whilst earning a starting salary of £35,000!




Our Sustainability team plays a crucial role in integrating the Danone Impact Journey into our business operations, bringing our purpose to life. We lead the charge in fulfilling our environmental commitments and driving community impact programs.




As a Data Analyst in the Sustainability team, you'll gain invaluable experience in data analysis and reporting, empowering us to make informed, evidence-based decisions for maximum impact. Throughout your journey, you'll receive comprehensive support while taking on key responsibilities, such as analysing the carbon footprint of new products and sustainability initiatives.




Across the two years you could be:




Gathering data and insights to help us understand our sustainability and carbon impact.
Managing mandatory reports, working to improve accuracy, and identifying opportunities for improvement.
Collaborating with stakeholders across the UK and Ireland, including logistics, procurement, sales and marketing, enhancing your communication skills.




You will have a direct impact on key sustainability projects including our carbon and environmental impact and reducing plastic & food waste.




What do we look for?




We'd like you to demonstrate smart thinking and emotional understanding by demonstrating how you solve problems and consider the perspectives of others. Show us your digital savvy and creativity by being comfortable with technology and sharing new ideas.




We value innovation and forward-thinking, so show us how you can envision the future and bring original ideas to life. Lastly, we’re looking for your motivation and passion, so show us your dedication, hard work, and enthusiasm for what you do.




You don’t need a degree or work experience to apply for our Early Careers programme. Our roles are designed to empower you on your professional journey, ensuring you have the skills and knowledge needed to thrive in your chosen career.




What do we offer?




As well as a starting salary of £35,000, if you’re motivated to deliver high performance, we’ll recognise your hard work with bi-annual salary reviews.




You’ll also enjoy a range of benefits, including:




A blend of classroom and on-the-job training, progressing to a manager level within two years.
Achieve work/life balance by aligning business needs with personal commitments, with key moments spent at your local office hub.
Dedicated volunteering time to give back to your local community.
Additionally, you'll receive 25 days of annual leave with the option to buy up to 5 more days, £120 of Danone products per year, discounted gym memberships and much more!




At the start of your Danone journey, you'll be part of a growing early talent community. We’ll provide high-quality learning and development support, fostering personal growth and deepening your understanding of the Danone ecosystem. You'll receive continuous feedback to help you stretch your boundaries, cultivate self-awareness, and gauge your progress.




DEI is deeply embedded in Danone's DNA, representing our core values and beliefs. We embrace diversity as a driving force for positive change, nurturing an inclusive workplace where every individual is valued.




You can join any of our six Employee Network Groups (ENGs); Pride (LGBTQIA+), Unity (BAME), DanoneAble (Accessibility), DanoneCare (Carers), WINGs (Womens Wellbeing), Danone Parents.




Our ENGs provide guidance, share knowledge, and raise cultural awareness, connecting employees from diverse backgrounds while offering educational resources, personal growth opportunities, and platforms for idea sharing.




What comes next?




The role closes on 7th May, our Early Careers team will be in touch shortly to discuss the next steps.




Key Dates to consider




Our assessment centre is expected to take place on 25th June.
You must be available to start on 14th July.




In order for your application to be considered, you must be available for the dates above.




Want to stay in touch? Head over to our careers website or follow us on social media to discover Life at Danone.




Instagram: @DanoneUKICareers, TikTok @LifeAtDanoneUKI




For any technical support, please email support@smartrecruiters.com




For general support, please email danone@wearewiser.com




The 'Resume' and 'Message to The Hiring Team' sections are not required and will not be considered in your application, so please leave these blank.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for data? Join us to define and drive positive changes to help us remain at the front edge of consumer engagement through an interconnected ecosystem of touchpoints!

Based in Slough, this role will follow our hybrid working model (3 days a week in the office). No relocation assistance will be offered for this role.


Core Responsibilities





Harness data points to form a 360 view of the journeys our consumers, fans and families take across our digital touchpoints, connecting engagement data with key data points and insights from other parts of the business.
Transform reports into engaging and insightful presentations tailored for diverse stakeholders.
Represent the voice of the consumer through contact reporting and in-depth insights that drive key business decisions and transformation.
Build, develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, and dashboards to review and communicate performance metrics.
Analyse performance from a well-rounded view, transferring raw data into measurable insights using data points from quantitative and qualitative channels and touchpoints.
Work with partner business teams to proactively define analytic questions, scopes of work and align on priorities, all the while challenging status quo beliefs through insights.
Collaborate in cross-functional projects using data modelling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimisation opportunities.
Examine, interpret and report results of analytical initiatives and insight activities to stakeholders across the business.




Play your part in our team succeeding

LEGO Consumer & Shopper Engagement (CSE) has the objective of putting the voice of the consumer at the heart of everything we do, providing the insights to drive data-based decision making at all levels.

We are looking for a Business Insights Analyst to bring their skills with data analysis, insights creation and communication to contribute to our growth and development. Our data comes from a wide range of interactions with consumers, from phone calls to chatbots to social media, and is evolving all the time. We have the vision to fully utilise this data to drive consumer-focused decision making across the business, and this position will play a key role in driving the realisation.

Do you have what it takes?





Experience working with databases, producing data analytics and reporting.
Proven communication and presentation skills to deliver and present deep-dive reports to various stakeholders.
Strong storytelling ability.
Advanced ability to utilise various data sources to synthesise insights.
Hands-on experience with Power BI or Tableau. SQL/Python and Adobe Analytics would be an advantage.
Excellent communication and partner management skills, including proactively defining questions, scope, and delivery.
Ability to work both independently and in close collaboration with cross-functional project teams.
Engagement and understanding of other business areas, data/insights sources, strategies, challenges.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k-£45k (DOE)




Are you a data enthusiast looking to make an impact across multiple industries? Join a leading data consultancy in London that partners with clients in finance, retail, and healthcare to deliver data-driven solutions that transform their business operations.




My client is seeking a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills and a passion for leveraging data to solve complex problems. In this role, you'll work with a diverse portfolio of clients, using data insights to drive meaningful business improvements.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets: Extract, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends and insights that inform key business strategies across finance, retail, and healthcare sectors.
Support decision-making: Use statistical methods and predictive models to assist clients in making data-driven decisions that improve their performance and efficiency.
Create data visualisations: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports to clearly communicate data insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with clients and internal teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, consultants, and client representatives, to ensure that data projects align with client goals.
Identify opportunities: Continuously explore ways to optimise processes, identify business opportunities, and deliver actionable recommendations to clients.




You Will Need:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field: Preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Experience with data analysis tools: Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis, manipulation, and reporting.
Data visualisation skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to present complex data in a user-friendly format.
Strong analytical mindset: Ability to understand and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear and actionable conclusions for clients.
Excellent communication skills: Capable of conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Industry experience: Prior experience working with clients in finance, retail, or healthcare, and familiarity with sector-specific data challenges.
Exposure to advanced analytics: Knowledge of machine learning techniques, predictive modeling, or advanced statistical analysis.
Problem-solving approach: A proactive, solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to think critically and creatively.




The Benefits:

Diverse projects: Gain experience working with clients across multiple industries, ensuring no two days are the same.
Learning and development: Access to training and mentorship to support your growth and help you stay at the forefront of data trends.
Collaborative work environment: Join a dynamic and supportive team of data experts, all working towards delivering exceptional results for clients.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your experience and expertise, along with performance-based incentives.




If you’re a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Are you a data enthusiast looking to make an impact across multiple industries? Join a leading data consultancy in London that partners with clients in finance, retail, and healthcare to deliver data-driven solutions that transform their business operations.


My client is seeking a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills and a passion for leveraging data to solve complex problems. In this role, you'll work with a diverse portfolio of clients, using data insights to drive meaningful business improvements.

If you’re a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Provelio are currently looking for a Graduate Data Analyst to join their growing team in the South West and/or London to help deliver a diverse portfolio of data development projects.

The analyst will assist in the following activities:


Produce any project initiation documentation, project proposals and appointment terms.
Agree and action any technical and quality strategies for gathering the required data or information flows.
Help clients make evidence-based decisions to reduce their costs and drive productivity.
Be responsible for project administration.
Develop and maintain complex data models in SQL Server and PowerBI.
Translate raw inputs into meaningful management information.
Able to provide clear and succinct briefs to clients and other stakeholders on project requirements/findings.
Identify best practice approaches for data modelling to ensure continual improvement.
Clearly document key assumptions and processes to enable client and other stakeholders to replicate and understand your data models.
Able to direct and motivate others in the project team.
Manage project risks and issues including the development of contingency/mitigation plans.


The successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:


Able to demonstrate a strong understanding of Microsoft Excel for data transformation, modelling and data analysis.
Able to manipulate and restructure data using SQL.
Experience in SQL Server or equivalent database platforms.
Proficient in PowerBI DAX Code and using PowerBI to demonstrate complex issues to laymen users.
Maintains a strong attention to detail and is able to analyse information critically.
Maintain self-discipline and focus on the task at hand with minimal supervision.
Ability to scrutinise your own work before presenting it to senior management or clients.
Able to learn and adapt quickly under strict time constraints.
Able to interpret data and put findings into context.
Proficient in other Microsoft Office programmes


Benefits

Provelio take pride in investing in their employees and rewarding success. Our benefits and reward package for all employees includes...


Company Bonus Schemes
Training and Chartership Sponsorship
Payment of Professional Membership Fees
Hybrid Working
Enhanced Holiday Entitlement (28 days plus bank holidays)
Workplace Pension (above statutory minimum)
Additional Annual Leave for Reserves
Access to 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme (inc. GP services)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Duration: 12 months, extensions likely

Location: London/Hybrid (three days per week in the office requirement)

Salary:£200 per day PAYE




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage, please let us know and we will be happy to support you.




Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey in the world of rewards and benefits? Our client, a leading organisation in the banking industry, is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join their dynamic HR team. This is a unique opportunity to gain in-depth experience in a complex regulated environment while working alongside industry experts!




What You’ll Do:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in supporting the EMEA Reward Team, which oversees compensation and performance processes for over 3000 employees across 17 locations. Your responsibilities will include:




Performance and Reward:

Assisting with the implementation of the annual performance cycle.
Coordinating projects across teams and collaborating with the HR Technology team.
Supporting the management of deferred compensation, including processing joiners, leavers, and payments.
Managing MRT attestations and cross-border mobility cases as needed.




Benefits Management:

Handling various data processes for the benefits team.
Reconciling and approving vendor invoices and processing monthly DB contributions.
Managing contracts and vendor relationships.
Addressing employee queries related to pensions, benefits, performance, and compensation matters.




Who You Are:

A proactive individual with strong Excel and Macro’s skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.
Recent graduates are encouraged to apply—training will be provided!




Why Join Us?

Hybrid Working: Enjoy a flexible work environment that balances remote and in-office work.
Professional Growth: Gain valuable insights into the rewards and compensation landscape.
Supportive Team: Work alongside a talented team dedicated to making a difference.
Vibrant Workplace: Join a dynamic culture that values collaboration and innovation.




If you’re enthusiastic about building a rewarding career in HR and eager to contribute to a thriving organisation, we want to hear from you!




How to Apply:




To apply for this opportunity, please apply with an up-to-date CV. Candidates should ideally demonstrate evidence of the above responsibilities in their CV to be considered.




Please note that if you haven't heard from us within 48 hours, your application may not have been successful on this occasion. However, we may keep your details on file for future vacancies and contact you accordingly.
